column4: Hello. Look, my mom has some problem with Ubuntu. Unfortunately, she doesn't know much about computers and I'm 1800km away from her. The problem is that when she enters some specific site (using firefox) which has some kind of flash animation, the computer freezes. Maybe she has an old version of Ubuntu, because she doesn't know how to update. I told her by phone that she had to reinstall the flash plugin, but we didn't know what package it was
Could you see everything I wrote?
flash-nonfree probably, but if its an older version it may not work
I told her to search for "flash" in Synaptic, but that plugin did not appear.
